vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
θρέμμ-α, ατος, τό,
(τρέφω) nursling, creature, θ. Νηρεΐδων, of dolphins, [Refs 6th c.BC+]; mostly of tame animals, especially sheep and goats, [NT+5th c.BC+]; τὰ ἐν ταῖς ἀγέλαις θ. [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ὑηνὰ θ. [Refs]; of game-cocks and quails, ὀρνίθων θ[Refs]: generally, animals, τοῖς ἡμέροις καὶ ἀγρίοις.. θ. [Refs]
__2 of men, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; Χαρίτων θ. [Refs 5th c.BC+]; especially of domestic slaves,= Latin verna, τὸ Χρυσίππου θ. [Refs]
__3 generally, creature, ἄπλατον θ. κἀπροσήγορον, of a lion, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; of Cerberus, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; κακὰ θ., of a swarm of gnats, [Refs 1st c.BC+]; θ. Σελινοῦντος, of a fish, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; Καρύστου θ., comic for a cup made at Carystus, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; as a term of reproach, θρέμματ᾽ οὐκ ἀνασχετά [Refs 5th c.BC+]; in periphrastic, ὕδρας θ., for ὕδρα, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; θρέμματα παλλακῶν kept mistresses, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: livestock, domestic animal (usually a sheep or goat)
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
livestock, domestic animal (usually a sheep or goat)
that which is reared, (especially sheep and goats); plural cattle, Jn. 4:12*
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: con vật nuôi ; chăn nuôi, (cừu, dê); đàn vật nuôi. (Hapax)
